publicationstmt.publisher: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard)

address.addressline: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

physdesc.extent: .41 cubic feet (4 folders and 1 oversize folder)

did.abstract: Collection includes diaries, certificates, architectural plans, etc. regarding members of the Flanders family.

scopecontent.p: Collection includes: Diary of Maria Louise Flanders, 1926-1929; Brass bookplate belonging to John Couch Flanders; Petition recommending George H. Flanders for Revenue Inspector for the City of Portland, n.d.; Memorial tribute for George H. Flanders, 1892; House specifications, 1 vol., ca. 1930, by Jamieson Parker for a house for Maria and Caroline Flanders in Portland Heights, Portland, Oregon; Miscellaneous certificates, 1881-1952; Miscellaneous correspondence, 1930-1952, primarily regarding the formation of Ecola State Park; Documents relating to Ecola State Park, 1942-1952.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to the public.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society is the owner of the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. Written permission must be obtained from the Research Library prior to any use of reproductions. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all the materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use of reproductions may require seeking additional authorization from the copyright holders.

prefercite.p: Flanders Family Papers, Mss 1392, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.
